sentences.en: But it is the essence of scientific method to limit its own pretension.
sentences.cn: 但是,科学方法的本质正是要对它自己的要求加以限制.
摩擦力随预加张力的增加而增加.

sentences.en: He finds human foibles endearing, but is unforgiving of pretension.
sentences.cn: 他觉得人性的弱点很可爱，但不能容忍惺惺作态。

sentences.en: He has no pretension ( s ) to learning.
sentences.cn: 他不能自称[ 说不上 ] 有学问.

sentences.en: He makes no pretension ( s ) to skill.

sentences.cn: 他毫无矫饰之心,虚荣之意.

sentences.en: Intellectual pretension was never one of his vices.
It is the most impudent piece of pretension I ever heard of in my life.
sentences.cn: 这是我一生中从没听说过的最厚颜无耻的一项要求了.

sentences.en: Kuo - yu's vision and technique progress hand - in - hand , true and faithful, pure and without pretension or superficial effects.
sentences.cn: 国钰的洞悉力与绘画技巧肩并肩地进步著, 真确又忠实 、 纯净又不矫饰,且无任何肤浅的表像.

sentences.en: No one who has the slightest pretension to literary tastes insensible to its attraction.
sentences.cn: 凡自以为稍有一点儿文学品位的人都不会对它的吸引力无动于衷.

sentences.en: Readers may find the pretension and arrogance of her style irritating.
sentences.cn: 读者可以感觉到她文章中的狂妄自负令人反感.

sentences.en: Self - reliance is sneered at as an absurd suburban pretension.
sentences.cn: 依靠自己被讥笑为一种荒唐的偏狭的见解.

sentences.en: She talks of her rich friends with great pretension.
sentences.cn: 她以夸耀口吻谈到她有钱的朋友.

sentences.en: the humbleness and lack of pretension of Jordan’s cafe
sentences.cn: 乔丹的咖啡馆的朴实和低调

sentences.en: We like him for his honesty, his lack of pretension.
sentences.cn: 我们喜欢他的诚实、不浮夸。

sentences.en: When holding the line pretension of cable and increasing pretension of membrane, structural curvature increases.
sentences.cn: 当保持索中的预拉力不变,增加膜的预张力时, 所得结构的曲率增大.

words.tran_cn: 冒牌者；妄求者；妄提要求者
借口；虚假；炫耀；自吹（等于pretence）
自负；要求；主张；借口；骄傲

trans.tran_cn: 假装，做作，要求，主张，自负，借口
trans.tran_en: an attempt to seem more important, more intelligent, or of a higher class than you really are
